member.name: T:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods for querying objects that implement . The actual methods are implemented in files reflecting the method name.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Fold``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns the result of applying a function to a sequence of 1 element.
member.remarks: This operator uses immediate execution and effectively buffers as many items of the source sequence as necessary.

member.param: The sequence of items to fold.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.SkipUntil``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Skips items from the input sequence until the given predicate returns true when applied to the current source item; that item will be the last skipped.

remarks.para: SkipUntil differs from Enumerable.SkipWhile in two respects. Firstly, the sense of the predicate is reversed: it is expected that the predicate will return false to start with, and then return true - for example, when trying to find a matching item in a sequence.
Secondly, SkipUntil skips the element which causes the predicate to return true. For example, in a sequence { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 } and with a predicate of x => x == 3, the result would be { 4, 5 }.

SkipUntil is as lazy as possible: it will not iterate over the source sequence until it has to, it won't iterate further than it has to, and it won't evaluate the predicate until it has to. (This means that an item may be returned which would actually cause the predicate to throw an exception if it were evaluated, so long as it comes after the first item causing the predicate to return true.)

member.typeparam: Type of the source sequence
member.param: Source sequence
Predicate used to determine when to stop yielding results from the source.
member.returns: Items from the source sequence after the predicate first returns true when applied to the item.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ExceptBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns the set of elements in the first sequence which aren't in the second sequence, according to a given key selector.
member.remarks: This is a set operation; if multiple elements in have equal keys, only the first such element is returned. This operator uses deferred execution and streams the results, although a set of keys from is immediately selected and retained.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the input sequences.
The type of the key returned by .
member.param: The sequence of potentially included elements.
The sequence of elements whose keys may prevent elements in from being returned.
The mapping from source element to key.
member.returns: A sequence of elements from whose key was not also a key for any element in .

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ExceptBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``1})
member.summary: Returns the set of elements in the first sequence which aren't in the second sequence, according to a given key selector.
member.remarks: This is a set operation; if multiple elements in have equal keys, only the first such element is returned. This operator uses deferred execution and streams the results, although a set of keys from is immediately selected and retained.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the input sequences.
The type of the key returned by .
member.param: The sequence of potentially included elements.
The sequence of elements whose keys may prevent elements in from being returned.
The mapping from source element to key.
The equality comparer to use to determine whether or not keys are equal. If null, the default equality comparer for TSource is used.
member.returns: A sequence of elements from whose key was not also a key for any element in .

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.AssertCount``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Asserts that a source sequence contains a given count of elements.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in sequence.
member.param: Source sequence.
Count to assert.
member.returns: Returns the original sequence as long it is contains the number of elements specified by . Otherwise it throws .
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.AssertCount``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Exception})
member.summary: Asserts that a source sequence contains a given count of elements. A parameter specifies the exception to be thrown.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in sequence.
member.param: Source sequence.
Count to assert.
Function that returns the object to throw.
member.returns: Returns the original sequence as long it is contains the number of elements specified by . Otherwise it throws the object returned by calling .
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Acquire``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Ensures that a source sequence of objects are all acquired successfully. If the acquisition of any one fails then those successfully acquired till that point are disposed.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in sequence.
member.param: Source sequence of objects.
member.returns: Returns an array of all the acquired object and in source order.
member.remarks: This operator executes immediately.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Concat``1(``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns a sequence consisting of the head element and the given tail elements.
member.typeparam: Type of sequence
member.param: Head element of the new sequence.
All elements of the tail. Must not be null.
member.returns: A sequence consisting of the head elements and the given tail elements.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Concat``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},``0)
member.summary: Returns a sequence consisting of the head elements and the given tail element.
member.typeparam: Type of sequence
member.param: All elements of the head. Must not be null.
Tail element of the new sequence.
member.returns: A sequence consisting of the head elements and the given tail element.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Consume``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Completely consumes the given sequence. This method uses immediate execution, and doesn't store any data during execution.
member.typeparam: Element type of the sequence
member.param: Source to consume

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Batch``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Batches the source sequence into sized buckets.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in sequence.
member.param: The source sequence.
Size of buckets.
member.returns: A sequence of equally sized buckets containing elements of the source collection.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results (buckets and bucket content).

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Batch``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32,System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},``1})
member.summary: Batches the source sequence into sized buckets and applies a projection to each bucket.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in sequence.
Type of result returned by .
member.param: The source sequence.
Size of buckets.
The projection to apply to each bucket.
member.returns: A sequence of projections on equally sized buckets containing elements of the source collection.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results (buckets and bucket content).

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.OrderedMerge``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Merges two ordered sequences into one. Where the elements equal in both sequences, the element from the first sequence is returned in the resulting sequence.
member.remarks: This method uses deferred execution. The behavior is undefined if the sequences are unordered as inputs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.OrderedMerge``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0})
member.summary: Merges two ordered sequences into one with an additional parameter specifying how to compare the elements of the sequences. Where the elements equal in both sequences, the element from the first sequence is returned in the resulting sequence.
member.remarks: This method uses deferred execution. The behavior is undefined if the sequences are unordered as inputs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.OrderedMerge``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Merges two ordered sequences into one with an additional parameter specifying the element key by which the sequences are ordered. Where the keys equal in both sequences, the element from the first sequence is returned in the resulting sequence.
member.remarks: This method uses deferred execution. The behavior is undefined if the sequences are unordered (by key) as inputs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.OrderedMerge``3(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``2},System.Func{``0,``2},System.Func{``0,``0,``2})
member.summary: Merges two ordered sequences into one. Additional parameters specify the element key by which the sequences are ordered, the result when element is found in first sequence but not in the second, the result when element is found in second sequence but not in the first and the result when elements are found in both sequences.
member.remarks: This method uses deferred execution. The behavior is undefined if the sequences are unordered (by key) as inputs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.OrderedMerge``3(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``2},System.Func{``0,``2},System.Func{``0,``0,``2},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``1})
member.summary: Merges two ordered sequences into one. Additional parameters specify the element key by which the sequences are ordered, the result when element is found in first sequence but not in the second, the result when element is found in second sequence but not in the first, the result when elements are found in both sequences and a method for comparing keys.
member.remarks: This method uses deferred execution. The behavior is undefined if the sequences are unordered (by key) as inputs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.OrderedMerge``4(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1},System.Func{``0,``2},System.Func{``1,``2},System.Func{``0,``3},System.Func{``1,``3},System.Func{``0,``1,``3})
member.summary: Merges two heterogeneous sequences ordered by a common key type into a homogeneous one. Additional parameters specify the element key by which the sequences are ordered, the result when element is found in first sequence but not in the second and the result when element is found in second sequence but not in the first, the result when elements are found in both sequences.
member.remarks: This method uses deferred execution. The behavior is undefined if the sequences are unordered (by key) as inputs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.OrderedMerge``4(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1},System.Func{``0,``2},System.Func{``1,``2},System.Func{``0,``3},System.Func{``1,``3},System.Func{``0,``1,``3},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``2})
member.summary: Merges two heterogeneous sequences ordered by a common key type into a homogeneous one. Additional parameters specify the element key by which the sequences are ordered, the result when element is found in first sequence but not in the second, the result when element is found in second sequence but not in the first, the result when elements are found in both sequences and a method for comparing keys.
member.remarks: This method uses deferred execution. The behavior is undefined if the sequences are unordered (by key) as inputs.

member.summary: Returns a sequence of where the key is the zero-based index of the value in the source sequence.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in sequence.
member.param: The source sequence.
member.returns: A sequence of .
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Index``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a sequence of where the key is the index of the value in the source sequence. An additional parameter specifies the starting index.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in sequence.
member.param: The source sequence.
member.returns: A sequence of .
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.TakeLast``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a specified number of contiguous elements from the end of a sequence.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: The sequence to return the last element of.
The number of elements to return.
member.returns: An that contains the specified number of elements from the end of the input sequence.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.TakeUntil``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Returns items from the input sequence until the given predicate returns true when applied to the current source item; that item will be the last returned.

remarks.para: TakeUntil differs from Enumerable.TakeWhile in two respects. Firstly, the sense of the predicate is reversed: it is expected that the predicate will return false to start with, and then return true - for example, when trying to find a matching item in a sequence.
Secondly, TakeUntil yields the element which causes the predicate to return true. For example, in a sequence { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 } and with a predicate of x => x == 3, the result would be { 1, 2, 3 }.

TakeUntil is as lazy as possible: it will not iterate over the source sequence until it has to, it won't iterate further than it has to, and it won't evaluate the predicate until it has to. (This means that an item may be returned which would actually cause the predicate to throw an exception if it were evaluated, so long as no more items of data are requested.)

member.typeparam: Type of the source sequence
member.param: Source sequence
Predicate used to determine when to stop yielding results from the source.
member.returns: Items from the source sequence, until the predicate returns true when applied to the item.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.BuildOrBindSchema(System.Data.DataTable,System.Reflection.MemberInfo[])
member.remarks: The resulting array may contain null entries and those represent columns for which there is no source member supplying a value.

Expressions providing access to element members.
member.returns: A or subclass representing the source.
member.remarks: This operator uses immediate execution.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ToDelimitedString(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates a delimited string from a sequence of values. The delimiter used depends on the current culture of the executing thread.
member.remarks: This operator uses immediate execution and effectively buffers the sequence.
member.param: The sequence of items to delimit. Each is converted to a string using the simple ToString() conversion.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ToDelimitedString(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Boolean},System.String)
member.summary: Creates a delimited string from a sequence of values and a given delimiter.
member.remarks: This operator uses immediate execution and effectively buffers the sequence.
member.param: The sequence of items to delimit. Each is converted to a string using the simple ToString() conversion.
The delimiter to inject between elements. May be null, in which case the executing thread's current culture's list separator is used.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ToDelimitedString(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt16})
member.summary: Creates a delimited string from a sequence of values. The delimiter used depends on the current culture of the executing thread.
member.remarks: This operator uses immediate execution and effectively buffers the sequence.
member.param: The sequence of items to delimit. Each is converted to a string using the simple ToString() conversion.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ToDelimitedString(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt16},System.String)
member.summary: Creates a delimited string from a sequence of values and a given delimiter.
member.remarks: This operator uses immediate execution and effectively buffers the sequence.
member.param: The sequence of items to delimit. Each is converted to a string using the simple ToString() conversion.
The delimiter to inject between elements. May be null, in which case the executing thread's current culture's list separator is used.

member.remarks: This evaluates the input sequence completely.
member.param: Source sequence
member.returns: A hash set of the items in the sequence, using the default equality comparer.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ToHashSet``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``0})

member.param: Source sequence whose elements to trace.
member.returns: Return the source sequence unmodified.
member.remarks: This a pass-through operator that uses deferred execution and streams the results.

String to use to format the trace message. If null then the element value becomes the traced message.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Trace``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.String})

Function used to format each source element into a string.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Pipe``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Executes the given action on each element in the source sequence and yields it.
member.remarks: The returned sequence is essentially a duplicate of the original, but with the extra action being executed while the sequence is evaluated. The action is always taken before the element is yielded, so any changes made by the action will be visible in the returned sequence. This operator uses deferred execution and streams it results.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the sequence
member.param: The sequence of elements
The action to execute on each element

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ForEach``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Immediately executes the given action on each element in the source sequence.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the sequence
member.param: The sequence of elements
The action to execute on each element

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ForEach``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{``0,System.Int32})
member.summary: Immediately executes the given action on each element in the source sequence. Each element's index is used in the logic of the action.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the sequence
member.param: The sequence of elements
The action to execute on each element; the second parameter of the action represents the index of the source element.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.DistinctBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns all distinct elements of the given source, where "distinctness" is determined via a projection and the default equality comparer for the projected type.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams the results, although a set of already-seen keys is retained. If a key is seen multiple times, only the first element with that key is returned.
member.typeparam: Type of the source sequence
Type of the projected element
member.param: Source sequence
Projection for determining "distinctness"
member.returns: A sequence consisting of distinct elements from the source sequence, comparing them by the specified key projection.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.DistinctBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``1})
member.summary: Returns all distinct elements of the given source, where "distinctness" is determined via a projection and the specified comparer for the projected type.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams the results, although a set of already-seen keys is retained. If a key is seen multiple times, only the first element with that key is returned.
member.typeparam: Type of the source sequence
Type of the projected element
member.param: Source sequence
Projection for determining "distinctness"
The equality comparer to use to determine whether or not keys are equal. If null, the default equality comparer for TSource is used.
member.returns: A sequence consisting of distinct elements from the source sequence, comparing them by the specified key projection.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.GenerateByIndex``1(System.Func{System.Int32,``0})
member.summary: Returns a sequence of values based on indexes.
member.remarks: The sequence is (practically) infinite - the index ranges from 0 to int.MaxValue inclusive. This function defers execution and streams the results.
member.typeparam: Type of result to generate
member.param: Generation function to apply to each index
member.returns: A sequence

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Generate``1(``0,System.Func{``0,``0})
member.summary: Returns a sequence of values consecutively generated by a generator function.
member.typeparam: Type of elements to generate.
member.param: Value of first element in sequence
Generator function which takes the previous series element and uses it to generate the next element.
member.remarks: This function defers element generation until needed and streams the results.
member.example:
IEnumerable<int> result = Sequence.Generate(2, n => n * n).Take(5);
The result variable, when iterated over, will yield 2, 4, 16, 256, and 65536, in turn.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.GroupAdjacent``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Groups the adjacent elements of a sequence according to a specified key selector function.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
The type of the key returned by .
member.param: A sequence whose elements to group.
A function to extract the key for each element.
member.returns: A sequence of groupings where each grouping () contains the key and the adjacent elements in the same order as found in the source sequence.
member.remarks: This method is implemented by using deferred execution and streams the groupings. The grouping elements, however, are buffered. Each grouping is therefore yielded as soon as it is complete and before the next grouping occurs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.GroupAdjacent``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``1})

The type of the key returned by .

A function to extract the key for each element.
An to compare keys.
member.returns: A sequence of groupings where each grouping () contains the key and the adjacent elements in the same order as found in the source sequence.
member.remarks: This method is implemented by using deferred execution and streams the groupings. The grouping elements, however, are buffered. Each grouping is therefore yielded as soon as it is complete and before the next grouping occurs.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.GroupAdjacent``3(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``2})

The type of the elements in the resulting groupings.

A function to extract the key for each element.
A function to map each source element to an element in the resulting grouping.
member.returns: A sequence of groupings where each grouping () contains the key and the adjacent elements (of type ) in the same order as found in the source sequence.
member.remarks: This method is implemented by using deferred execution and streams the groupings. The grouping elements, however, are buffered. Each grouping is therefore yielded as soon as it is complete and before the next grouping occurs.

The type of the elements in the resulting groupings.

An to compare keys.

member.remarks: This method is implemented by using deferred execution and streams the groupings. The grouping elements, however, are buffered. Each grouping is therefore yielded as soon as it is complete and before the next grouping occurs.

Type of elements in second sequence
Type of elements in result sequence

Second sequence
Function to apply to each pair of elements

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ZipLongest``3(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1},System.Func{``0,``1,``2})
member.summary: Returns a projection of tuples, where each tuple contains the N-th element from each of the argument sequences.
member.remarks: If the two input sequences are of different lengths then the result sequence will always be as long as the longer of the two input sequences. The default value of the shorter sequence element type is used for padding. This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in first sequence
Type of elements in second sequence
Type of elements in result sequence
member.param: First sequence
Second sequence
Function to apply to each pair of elements

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Scan``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``0,``0})
member.summary: Peforms a scan (inclusive prefix sum) on a sequence of elements.
member.remarks: An inclusive prefix sum returns an equal-length sequence where the N-th element is the sum of the first N input elements. More generally, the scan allows any commutative binary operation, not just a sum. The exclusive version of Scan is . This operator uses deferred execution and streams its result.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in source sequence
member.param: Source sequence
Transformation operation
member.returns: The scanned sequence

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Scan``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},``1,System.Func{``1,``0,``1})
member.summary: Like except returns the sequence of intermediate results as well as the final one. An additional parameter specifies a seed.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its result.
member.example:
var result = Enumerable.Range(1, 5).Scan(0, (a, b) => a + b);
When iterated, result will yield { 0, 1, 3, 6, 10, 15 }.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in source sequence
Type of state
member.param: Source sequence
Initial state to seed
Transformation operation
member.returns: The scanned sequence

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.PreScan``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``0,``0},``0)
member.summary: Performs a pre-scan (exclusive prefix sum) on a sequence of elements.
member.remarks: An exclusive prefix sum returns an equal-length sequence where the N-th element is the sum of the first N-1 input elements (the first element is a special case, it is set to the identity). More generally, the pre-scan allows any commutative binary operation, not just a sum. The inclusive version of PreScan is . This operator uses deferred execution and streams its result.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in source sequence
member.param: Source sequence
Transformation operation
Identity element (see remarks)
member.returns: The scanned sequence

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.Pairwise``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns a sequence resulting from applying a function to each element in the source sequence and its predecessor, with the exception of the first element which is only returned as the predecessor of the second element.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
The type of the element of the returned sequence.
member.param: The source sequence.
A transform function to apply to each pair of sequence.
member.returns: Returns the resulting sequence.
member.remarks: This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.

member.param: The sequence to pad.
The width/length below which to pad.
member.returns: Returns a sequence that is at least as wide/long as the width/length specified by the parameter.

members.member:
Prepends a single value to a sequence.
The type of the elements of . The sequence to prepend to. The value to prepend.
Returns a sequence where a value is prepended to it.
This operator uses deferred execution and streams its results.
int[] numbers = { 1, 2, 3 }; IEnumerable<int> result = numbers.Prepend(0);
The result variable, when iterated over, will yield 0, 1, 2 and 3, in turn.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.MinBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns the minimal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection.
member.remarks: If more than one element has the minimal projected value, the first one encountered will be returned. This overload uses the default comparer for the projected type. This operator uses immediate execution, but only buffers a single result (the current minimal element).
member.typeparam: Type of the source sequence
Type of the projected element
member.param: Source sequence
Selector to use to pick the results to compare
member.returns: The minimal element, according to the projection.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.MinBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``1})
member.summary: Returns the minimal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection and the specified comparer for projected values.
member.remarks: If more than one element has the minimal projected value, the first one encountered will be returned. This operator uses immediate execution, but only buffers a single result (the current minimal element).
member.typeparam: Type of the source sequence
Type of the projected element
member.param: Source sequence
Selector to use to pick the results to compare
Comparer to use to compare projected values
member.returns: The minimal element, according to the projection.

member.summary: Returns the maximal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection.

member.typeparam: Type of the source sequence
Type of the projected element
member.param: Source sequence
Selector to use to pick the results to compare
member.returns: The maximal element, according to the projection.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.MaxBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``1})
member.summary: Returns the maximal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection and the specified comparer for projected values.
member.remarks: If more than one element has the maximal projected value, the first one encountered will be returned. This operator uses immediate execution, but only buffers a single result (the current maximal element).

Type of the projected element
member.param: Source sequence
Selector to use to pick the results to compare
Comparer to use to compare projected values
member.returns: The maximal element, according to the projection.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.SingleOrFallback``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Returns the single element in the given sequence, or the result of executing a fallback delegate if the sequence is empty. This method throws an exception if there is more than one element in the sequence.
member.remarks: The fallback delegate is not executed if the sequence is non-empty. This operator uses immediate execution and has optimizations for sources.
member.typeparam: Element type of sequence
member.param: The source sequence
The fallback delegate to execute if the sequence is empty
member.exception: The sequence has more than one element
member.returns: The single element in the sequence, or the result of calling the fallback delegate if the sequence is empty.
